It currently supports essential inline syntaxes, such as: emphasize, strong, sub, sup, insert, delete, and highlighted. These can be nested, of course. It also handles verbatim (code) and embedded math like \(a^2+b^2=c^2\) or \[\sum_{n=0} ^ {\infty} \frac {f^{(n)}(a)}{n!} (x-a)^{n},\] which are essential for my needs.
